text:
The sun shone into the room. 

Nastasya stood beside Raskolnikov and a stranger. 

“Who is this, Nastasya?” he asked, pointing. 

“I say, he’s himself again!” she replied. 

“He is himself,” the stranger echoed. 

The landlady peeped in, then closed the door. 

“Who… are you?” Raskolnikov continued. 

The door flung open. 

Razumihin ducked as he entered. 

“What a cabin! I’m always knocking my head!” 

“So you are conscious, brother?” he exclaimed. 

“He has just come to,” Nastasya said. 

“Just come to,” the stranger smiled. 

“And who are you?” Razumihin asked. 

“My name is Vrazumihin, at your service.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov regains consciousness and is surrounded by curious onlookers, including a messenger and his friend Razumihin.
